B1 [ U ] the way that someone behaves: Her behaviour is often appalling. He was notorious for his violent and threatening behaviour.

[ C or U ]
  biology, chemistry, physics, psychology
  specialized the way that a person, an animal, a substance, etc. behaves in a particular situation or under particular conditions: His research involved the study of instinctive behaviour in birds. These behaviours can be observed among many children who have lost a parent or other loved one.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has always demanded the highest standards of behaviour from his children.The stupid behaviour of one pupil has brought discredit on the whole school.His casual behaviour was wholly inappropriate for such a formal occasion.After a while her behaviour really began to irritate me.I'd just met his parents for the first time so I was on my best behaviour.
